home.title: What fish are you buying?
home.subtitle: Scan the label or search by species

wizard.step1_subtitle: Type the name of the fish
wizard.step2_subtitle: This information is on the price label
wizard.step3_subtitle: Check the label or counter sign
wizard.farmed_hint: üí° For farmed fish, certification labels in the next step are the key to sustainability.
wizard.unknown_note: Check the price label at the fish counter ‚Äî EU law requires the production method to be shown. Look for "Caught at sea", "Farmed" or "Caught in freshwater". If it genuinely isn't shown, the score will be an estimate from population data only (low confidence).
wizard.area_dont_know_hint: Look on the price label or counter sign for text like "Northeast Atlantic" or a FAO code like "FAO 27" or "FAO 37".
wizard.gear_dont_know_hint: Look on the label for the fishing method: "Trawl", "Seine", "Longline" or "Hook and line". EU law requires it to be listed for wild-caught fish.
wizard.gear_pole_and_line: Pole and line / Hook and line
wizard.info_production_meaning: Wild fish are caught from the ocean or rivers. Farmed fish are raised in controlled facilities. This matters because farming practices vary hugely in environmental impact.
wizard.info_production_where: On the price label at the fish counter or on the packaging. EU law requires it.
wizard.info_area_meaning: The same species can be overfished in one region and healthy in another. The origin tells us which stock we're dealing with.
wizard.info_area_where: On the price label ‚Äî it usually says "Northeast Atlantic" or includes a code like "FAO 27" or "FAO 34".
wizard.info_gear_meaning: The method determines the damage to the seafloor, how many non-target species are killed, and how selective the catch is. Trawls are most destructive; pole & line and longline are most selective.
wizard.info_gear_where: On the label or packaging ‚Äî EU law requires the gear category to be listed for wild-caught fish.
wizard.info_cert_meaning: Certified labels mean an independent body has verified the fishery meets sustainability standards. MSC is for wild-caught fish, ASC is for aquaculture.
wizard.info_cert_where: On the packaging or on the counter sign. Sometimes printed directly on the price label.
wizard.info_cert_example: Blue MSC fish logo, green ASC logo, "Dolphin Safe" label
wizard.step2_subtitle_counter: Look at the price label or counter sign
wizard.info_production_where_counter: On the price label or counter sign. EU law requires the fishmonger to display it ‚Äî look for "Caught at sea", "Farmed" or "Caught in freshwater".
wizard.info_production_where_packaged: On the front or back of the packaging. EU law requires it ‚Äî look for the production method label.
wizard.info_production_where_frozen: On the box or bag, near the product description or nutritional information.
wizard.info_area_where_counter: On the price label or counter sign ‚Äî usually says "Northeast Atlantic" or includes a code like "FAO 27". Ask the fishmonger if not visible.
wizard.info_area_where_packaged: On the packaging ‚Äî look for "Northeast Atlantic", "Mediterranean", or a code like "FAO 27" or "FAO 37".
wizard.info_area_where_frozen: On the box or bag ‚Äî look for the fishing zone or FAO code near the product description.
wizard.info_gear_where_counter: On the price label or counter sign. EU law requires it for wild-caught fish. Ask the fishmonger if not visible.
wizard.info_gear_where_packaged: On the front or back of the packaging ‚Äî listed as "Fishing method" or similar.
wizard.info_gear_where_frozen: On the box or bag ‚Äî look for "Fishing method" near the product details.
wizard.info_cert_where_counter: On the packaging or on the counter sign. Sometimes printed directly on the price label.
wizard.info_cert_where_packaged: On the front of the packaging, usually in a prominent position.
wizard.info_cert_where_frozen: On the box or bag, usually on the front.

about.title: Methodology
about.scoring_explanation: The score is based on IUCN conservation status, fishing method, and FAO catch area.
about.iucn_source: IUCN 2025. IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2025-2 ‚Äî Global conservation status
about.iucn_citation: IUCN 2025. IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2025-2. www.iucnredlist.org
about.disclaimer: Built for an environmental hackathon. Data updated periodically. The score is indicative ‚Äî it's always best to ask the fishmonger.
